node.title: Fully vaccinated travellers from Sydney and Melbourne allowed into SA from Tuesday
node.description: Fully vaccinated travellers from central Sydney and Melbourne will be allowed into South Australia when borders open on Tuesday, but there will be some restrictions for people coming for the Ashes Test.
node.content:
["Fully vaccinated travellers from central Sydney and Melbourne will be allowed into South Australia when borders open on Tuesday, the state's Premier announced today.", "SA Premier Steven Marshall said fully vaccinated travellers from every Victorian and New South Wales local government area will be permitted to travel, except for Byron Bay, which is yet to hit a vaccination rate of 80 per cent.", "But travellers from local government areas with vaccination rates lower than 90 per cent will be prevented from attending high-risk settings like aged care and major events such as the Adelaide Ashes Test.", "There had been some concern that a statistical anomaly meant people from the central Sydney and Melbourne local government areas\u00a0would be locked out when the borders reopen.", "\"This has caused\u00a0enormous frustration for people who\u00a0haven't been sure regarding whether\u00a0they can come in from next Tuesday\u00a0or not,\" Mr Marshall said.", "\"The good news is that's all been clarified now, and as of next Tuesday we are good to go.\"", "Those travelling from New South Wales, Victoria and the ACT will be required to have a COVID test in the 72 hours prior to arrival in SA, and must undergo a daily symptom check for 14 days via a phone app.", "Those who travel from a local government area with a vaccination rate of less than 90 per cent will also also have to undergo tests within 24 hours of arrival in SA, and again on days six\u00a0and 13.", "Mr Marshall said as of Tuesday anyone coming into South Australia needs to be fully vaccinated, regardless of which state they come from.", "Mr Marshall said exemptions would still be processed for unvaccinated travellers, but he expected the number of applications to \"plummet\".", "Vaccinated South Australians who leave for 72 hours or less will not be required to have a test prior to arrival.", "The vaccination requirements to enter South Australia will apply to anyone over\u00a012 years and two months.", "All travellers\u00a0will need to complete an online border entry process \u2013 to be known as EntryCheck SA \u2013 which will be available from 5pm today.", "The online EntryCheck system will assess an individual's vaccination status, departure location and COVID-19 risk.", "Based on the information provided, travellers may also be prompted to use a new HealthCheck SA app as part of their entry conditions.", "The app will help users monitor daily symptoms and guide them through any testing and quarantine requirements.", "The app will use both facial recognition and geolocation to ensure those entering the state from high risk locations are complying with quarantine requirements.", "From Tuesday, South Australians will be able to integrate their digital COVID-19 vaccination certificates into the mySA Gov app, which is used to QR check-in at venues.", "International arrivals will need to quarantine for seven days and must have had a negative COVID-19 test 72 hours prior to arriving.", "They must also take a test within 24 hours of arrival and again on day six and 13, and will not be allowed into high-risk settings or major events.", "", "
Deputy Chief Public Health Officer Emily Kirkpatrick said she expected a surge of travellers to apply to enter the state from Tuesday.(ABC News: Haidarr Jones)
", "Deputy Chief Medical Officer Dr\u00a0Emily Kirkpatrick said SA Health expected \"thousands\" of people to apply to enter the state when the system goes live at 5pm today.", "\"We're definitely expecting a surge of travellers coming across,\" she said.", "Mr Marshall said with borders reopening it was \"inevitable that there will be cases coming into South Australia\".", "\"We\u00a0want to minimise the risk of this disease taking hold in our state,\" he said."]
